radiographic_examinations.findings: The hepatic echotexture is within normal limits. A 1.1 x 1.1 x 0.8 cm echogenic lesion consistent with a hemangioma is seen in segment V of the liver. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilation; common hepatic duct measures 2 mm. Patent portal vein. Pancreas within normal limits. Nondistended gallbladder with no stones, abnormal gallbladder wall thickening, or pericholecystic fluid. Right kidney measures 10.7 cm, left kidney 11.6 cm; no stones, masses, or hydronephrosis. Spleen measures 9.6 cm. Normal abdominal aorta and IVC. No ascites. Targeted imaging shows a blind-ending tubular structure representing the appendix with echogenic indurated fat surrounding its tip and two shadowing appendicoliths.
